Lynn.General John Glover House: The General John Glover House is a National Historic Landmark at 11 Glover Street in Marblehead, Massachusetts. It is a ​2 1⁄2-story gambrel-roofed colonial built in 1762 by John Glover (1732–97), a local merchant, politician, and militia leader who gained fame for his military leadership in the American Revolutionary War. The house was declared a National Historic Landmark and added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1972, for its association with Glover, who lived here during the war years.
